parameters: var introText = "%PLAYER_NAME%! Geological monsters are\ncausing tremors in our science lab!";
var requestText = "Answer this earth science question to\nhelp stabilize the situation!";
var questionText = "What is the outer layer of the\nEarth called?";
var correctResponseText = "Exactly right! The crust is the\noutermost layer of the Earth!";
var wrongResponseText = "That's not correct. Come back when\nyou're ready to try again.";
var completionText = "Great job! Now help me save our\nplanet models from the science wing!";
// Track if the player has already completed this quiz
// Function to create a sequential message chain
// If this is the last message and it has choices, add them
// When current message is done, setup listener for next message
// Remove the listener to prevent multiple calls
// Unfortunately, RPG Maker MZ doesn't have the addEventListener method as described above.
// Instead, we need to use a different approach with common events and game switches.

// In RPG Maker, we have to use the "Show Text" command multiple times in sequence
// from the event editor, not from script.
// But for script purposes, we can use a workaround with conditional branches and message waiting

// Set up an interval to check when the message window is closed
